conclusion: Analyze forces and energy transformations acting on the conductor rod.
Rod is subject to gravitational force, magnetic force, and resistive forces.
Gravitational force component along the rail is mg sin Œ∏.
Induced EMF is given by ùìî = BLv.
Magnetic force F_magnetic = BIL = B^2L^2v / (R + r).
Net force F_net = mg sin Œ∏ - B^2L^2v / (R + r).
According to Newton's second law, F_net = ma.
ma = mg sin Œ∏ - B^2L^2v / (R + r).
Rod reaches maximum speed when a = 0.
v_max = mg sin Œ∏ (R + r) / B^2L^2.
Rod starts from rest, initial velocity v_0 = 0.
Using kinematic equation v = v_0 + at.
a = dv/dt, integrate to find time t to reach v_max.
a = g sin Œ∏ - B^2L^2v / m(R + r).
Integrate acceleration to find time: ‚à´_0^v_max dv / (g sin Œ∏ - B^2L^2v / m(R + r)) = ‚à´_0^t dt.
Solving integral gives: t = m(R + r) / B^2L^2 ln(mg sin Œ∏ (R + r) / B^2L^2).
Time t for the conductor rod to slide down and reach maximum speed is t = m(R + r) / B^2L^2 ln(mg sin Œ∏ (R + r) / B^2L^2).
